name: killport
description: Command-line tool to kill processes listening on a specific port

repo.name: killport
repo.description: A command-line tool to easily kill processes running on a specified port.

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and installation documentation with strong examples, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and deeper configuration details.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common errors like permission denied, process not found, or port not in use scenarios

injection_risks.description: The use of `writeln!` macro with user-controlled input (`record.args()`) could potentially lead to a format string vulnerability, but it's unlikely in this context.
The use of `docker.kill_container` with user-controlled input (`name`) could potentially lead to a command injection vulnerability if the container name is not properly sanitized.

security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows best practices.

common_complaints: Bug in port detection logic not working as expected
praise_themes: Feature requests are respectful and constructive
Community interest in library usage and additional features
sentiment.summary: Moderately healthy project with resolved platform support issues and active feature interest, but has an unresolved bug in core functionality (port detection) that lacks maintainer follow-up.

communication.summary: The responses are generally clear, helpful, and patient, with a good balance of technical depth and welcoming new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being from November 2025
3 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
0 closed issues in past 6 months suggests maintenance has stopped
positive_signals: Project exists and has a release history (at some point)
Open issues indicate the repository is still being monitored for problems
maintenance.summary: The killport project appears stale with no development activity, PR merges, issue resolution, or contributor engagement over the past 6 months.

governance.summary: The documentation lacks a succession plan and contributor ladder, indicating high bus factor risk.
